name: Jacob Soul Food Restaurant
address: 373 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

reviews.text: Didn't like the food
Always delicious.. hot & fresh
Oxtail and collard greens were on point yall keep up the good work
Great food and courteous staff with great music also.

We came from California to try this place we heard about. The food was delicious and plentiful. You pay by the weight. From the oxtails to the short ribs beyond, everything was good! The live music with the older gentleman and his guitar and the drummer and bass player, definitely made the place lively and fun! Good food, good music,  what more can you ask for! Highly recommended..will be back!üòãüòã
Good

One word: Delicious!
Heard about this place - it did not disappoint. In fact, exceeded expectation. Got to come back when I‚Äôm in NY (Harlem) again.

The the buffet is rather complete with hot food offerings, salads, fruits, and sweets. Unlike traditional soul food, their renditions are less seasoned, but are still tasty. The food is always fresh, as the restaurant gives away all unpurchased food at the end of the night to neighborhood shelters. Yea for humanity!

The food is good to great! I usually get a combo of salads and veggies, but the hot food is tasty, also. The variety varies from one site to another, so don't wait too close to closing, because you might not get what you want! Now I'm hungry! ü§§
Disgusting..they put red peppers in EVERYTHING , string beans , cabbage , collard greens all littered with red peppers ü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æ
The didn't have the Brisket I thought they would have, but the food is delicious.

Went to this recommended restaurant  after taking a tour of Harlem.  It is a buffet and they charge by the pound. A wide variety of food,beef,pork,chicken,fish, seafood,fruits and salads. Not just your standard soul food staples. Its not a fancy place,more clean cafeteria style seating and you bus your own tables  I had several dishes like a whole fish that were very tasty. I tried several types of dishes and nothing was bad. I preferred the fish and jerk chicken dishes (not too spicy tho)and wish i had room for more veggies and dessert dishes. They charge more for meat only plates, $10.99(?)and cards pay an extra fee as most do now. There's not a lot of indoor seating but we went at lunchtime and there was plenty.
Such a cozy place with amazing dishes. The desserts were outstanding!

Vous pouvez y allez les yeux ferm√©s, nous nous sommes r√©gal√©s apr√®s une messe gospel! Prix correct, honn√™te et beaucoup de choix, restaurant propre, nous avons √©t√© tr√®s bien re√ßu et mention sp√©ciale pour la musique √† partir de 13h üòÄüòç

The price matches the quality here. oh yes, the employees' friendly approach is authentic. Their dishes demonstrate how complex taste can be. The decor strikes the right balance. This restaurant will match your standards.
Not accessible for disabled at all

A place I will continue to return to time and time again.  Every single I pick from the buffet is outstanding.  My favorites being:
The collard greens!!!!!
The sauteed cabbage with garlic medley
The salmon
The fish pinwheel (I've only had it once and it was everything)
The mac & cheese
Rice & kidney beans
The sauteed olives

I love being here when there is live music.

A must-go for me whenever I'm in Harlem.
I went here for lunch recently and the food was very good they had a decent amount of options and it‚Äôs affordable!!
They over charge you every meal. They are hungry for money.
Really good food and reasonable prices. The service is also fast and reliable. Really enjoy the experience.

The environment here is as good as the menu. Their servings ensure you'll eat twice from one order. All staff members demonstrate excellence. The place has a good location and pleasant employees. No further input necessary.
Love
The decor inside ain't all that but they're food is delicious. I loved it.

Jacob Soul Food Restaurant I have my regular table that feels like it's just for me. You'll enjoy the relaxing, tidy, and attractive atmosphere. The kitchen produces dependable meals. The staff showed kind help. This restaurant ensures customer satisfaction.
Food was DAYAM good. You can sit outside. All the regular crazy NY stuff happens!
Love this place ‚ù§Ô∏è
Had a great experience with my wife and Friend food was delicious. Customer Service was great and it was very helpful.
Absolutely awesome soul food, i can't think of a better place, they even have live music on certain days, I strongly recommend Jacob, if you like soul food, you won't be disappointed
Buffet is  good

Food is good, don't have to wait. Value has been pinched a lot by inflation. Now it's $10 a pound and for a meal you're gonna spending about 20+ bucks. It's OK but fell off considerably. I just ate there and it tore my stomach UP. I had fried chicken, Mac and cheese and green beans with black eyed peas over rice with some avocados on the rice.

The cashier girl was unnecessarily rude too. She asked if I wanted a receipt I gave her a thumbs up she then ripped the receipt off and put it in the drawer and stared at me. I had to yell "yes I want one" because they have a band in there on Sundays. That's why I gave her a thumbs up. She then gave me a receipt and asked what that meant. She tried to act like she didn't know what a thumbs up meant. So weird to do all that.

I had been going less because of the price now, the food quality and customer service has lost a once daily customer.

Their customer service is bad. I had a bad experience when a old homeless woman came in to ask for food and one of the workers was pushing her out and  told her don't come back waving his hand like he was better than her. It could have been any bodies mother. I bought the woman some food she started to cry.
Great Food especially the BBQ wingssss!!!
Great food here, careful when adding stuff to your plate‚Ä¶ it all adds up ü§ßüíµ
Food is good but not exactly what I want looking for.
Amazing food, good prices and good options

Sooooooooo goooooood ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§
Whatever you get, make sure to leave room for their amazing banana pudding! You won‚Äôt wanna miss that, believe me!
Good food plenty of selections
All the workers was kind and friendly to their customers they made everyone's  feel welcome. I love this place. Good food  good.üòä
Sabina does it very nice job keeping this place clean it‚Äôs been here since 2008

Horrible, I only got sides as I am a vegetarian. The food was extremely under seasoned, Didn‚Äôt taste like salt or pepper at minimum was even used. The macaroni had an off putting taste, and the cabbage had a weird flavor. I‚Äôm not sure who is making the food behind the scenes, but in no way shape of form was there any soul.. cashews were pretty friendly, but we will not return unfortunately Feel like I want to vomit.ü§Æ
Self service con molta scelta. Prezzo onesto per l'ottima qualit√† del cibo.  Disponibile una sala interna semplice ma pulita. Personale gentile

Au c≈ìur d‚ÄôHarlem, un restaurant simple, mais avec une cuisine de qualit√©. Vous payez au poids pour deux nous avons mang√© pour 40 $ rechercher un restaurant √† Harlem rapport qualit√©, prix irr√©prochable.

Large variety of hot cold buffet foods. Nice staff.
Hit or miss depends on what the day you go and what chef  cooks!

Collard greens are cut way too large/over/under cooked.

Most meats are undercooked/overcooked- use of wrong seasonings or no seasoning at all..on fried chicken yams/raisins! -?

Great hot/ cold buffet -neat clean always tasty fresh..potatoe and kale salads excellent beet salad ect...ceasar ..great

Meats are always tough either over or under cooked -can't even chew it.

Clean establishment.. tidy..had excellent corvid protocols.

Never the less this restuarant needs to hire chefs that are experienced in cooking American Southern Soul Food.and Caribbean food.
The decor added to the overall amazing dining experience.

The food is ok, nothing special to Bragg about.  One thing I will say is they do not know how to accept criticism well.  The deserts are horrible and they will argue with you if you do not like their food
Trash, cold , expensive
Food is good, but it is room temperature.  Their bathroom toilet was broken.
My wife and I used to eat here periodically and 10 months out of Harlem I returned for a visit and had to have lunch here. The escovitch fish was delicious and the veggies flavored nicely.
Cute soul food buffet, there was a live band playing when we came in! Mac and cheese was great

Estupendo sitio para comer aut√©ntica comida "soul" a un buen precio y en un ambiente muy local y tranquilo. Amplio buffet de verduras frescas, carnes, pasta, arroces para acompa√±ar y fruta. Muy muy recomendable.

I was genuinely looking forward to trying their food. We host a large luncheon every month at work, and I was hoping they could become a regular vendor for us, especially given their extensive menu. Unfortunately, the experience was very disappointing.

The chicken lacked any flavor‚Äîcompletely unseasoned. Both the mac and cheese and collard greens were also severely under-seasoned and bland. Surprisingly, the sweet yams were the standout; they didn‚Äôt look like much, but they had a nice balance of sweetness and were quite enjoyable. The cornbread was forgettable, and the potato salad had an odd, off-putting flavor.

Overall, the food left much to be desired. Down right awful.

I also need to add, the staff was very nice. All smiles and very helpful.

Si vous voulez bien manger et pas cher c‚Äôest chez Jacob. Niveau qualit√© prix, ils sont imbattables. Les plats sont moins de 10 dollars le kilo. Et le dessert moins de 9 dollars le kilo. Vous prenez votre barquette, la remplissez et vous payez √† la caisse. C‚Äôest self service :)
Le dimanche, vous avez le midi, un concert en plus :)
On a fait notre cantine.
Le personnel parle fran√ßais et sont tr√®s gentils.

I love this place.
Went once in 2016 and recently in 2024. To this day it's the only place I've had fried chicken. Everything is done by weight so you'll pay less of you eat less. We got two really decent size meal and two soft drinks for 32 dollars. Good options for vegetables as well, which is not a given when traveling the US, I found.
üî•üî•üî• a great buffet style soul food establishment... Homemade drinks .. Amazing Food... Amazing Variety...#MustVisit

First the prices are inexpensive and you get a lot of food-they weigh everything and my container was heavy and I only spent 23-24 bucks- one thing I didn‚Äôt like was I tried to break the fish in half because the fish was really big and the worker YELLED AT ME. Not to break the fish,across a crowded room which was extremely embarrassing and unprofessional of them, The lady actually came over to me with a container, wanted me to take the whole fish. She was very unprofessional.

Soul food in buffet style with many yummy food.
I had salmon they made excellent, collard greens and asparagus also avocado salad, but my family tried almost everything‚Ä¶ my daughter a meat fan she had BBQ rib, pepper steak and beef on the bones.
My son and hubby pick up fired chicken and soft baked chicken with mac and cheese mashed potato and greens too. I seen they had oxtail, turkey, many different salad, fruits, banana bread pudding for sweets,
You can take out or you can seat and eat .
I choose outside sitting this place nice and clean, and can‚Äôt wait to eat that food .For me best on sunday especially if you don‚Äôt wanna cook or if everyone in your family wanna eat different combo.Also recommend people who works in the area the price is great for everybody pocket .
This two on the picture was $21 after we took 3 more box and paid all together $50 so each box $10 these days for hot food is a bless. Today we stop by again!! Still the best soul food in NYC! I take again the avocado salad with crab,it was  heaven‚Ä¶
Ladies adorable at the cashier. The gentleman just bring out right on time my son baked chicken fresh from the oven,perfectly seasoned! It‚Äôs  a long list from the food and all the good thing about this place! Told you a lot go,eat, enjoy!
Thank you for the delicious lunch!!

The buffet style food was delicious. The collard greens, mac and cheese, oxtails, fried chicken, fruits, salads, pasta, ribs, and more were laid out very appetizing. However, be aware that they do weigh your plate. That will affect the cost.

Best soul food experience.
Even better than expected, a very long variety of food
Salad bar
Soul food bar with a plenty of different kind of meat.
And dessert bar also

If I knew this place before I would came more often

This Soul Food spot in Harlem is a total gem! The staff is super welcoming, the prices won't empty your wallet, and the food is simply amazing. Plus, the place is really clean.

Service:
The staff is super friendly and makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk in.

Pricing:
Great prices for awesome food. You're getting a lot of bang for your buck here.

Food Quality:
The food is just incredible. Flavors are on point, and it tastes like someone's grandma is running the kitchen.

Cleanliness:
The place is clean as a whistle, so you can focus on enjoying your meal.

All in all, if you're in Harlem and craving some top-notch Soul Food, you've got to check this place out. You won't regret it!

I had my food catered for Christmas. I wasn't pleased. I ordered 14 different dishes. My time to pick up was noon. I was very, very late in picking it up. Potatoe salad who put peas and ü•ï in potatoes ü•î salad. Pineapple Glaze Ham gives the‚Ä¶

There are days when everything goes wrong. You plan a surprise, it fails. You try to go to a restaurant, it‚Äôs packed. You try another one, it‚Äôs closed‚Ä¶ üò≠
When this happens to me I tend to get stuck and become unable to make a decision.
That Sunday, in Harlem, NYC, I was in that kind of mood so my wife picked a restaurant for us, Jacob Soul Food Restaurant, based on its reviews on Google.
Jacob Soul Food is not a regular restaurant: there‚Äôs no service, no menu, no private table‚Ä¶ ü§î It‚Äôs like a self-service school restaurant. You help yourself with want you want to eat and then you pay according to the total weight of what you‚Äôve picked.
To be honnest, with my mood, it felt nice to be able to eat a bit of everything that looked good to me at that moment. It was not the best food of my life (not bad either, eh) but it was comforting üòå
The atmosphere of the restaurant was comforting too: there was some live music and people even were dancing üï∫üèøüíÉüèª
Plus we ate a lot for $15, which is not common in NYC, nowadays.
If you want to have the best food, that‚Äôs not the place. But if you want to feel good, go ahead!

Quality & taste: 6/10
Quantities: 10/10
Atmosphere: 7/10
Originality: 8/10
Ratio price / quality: 8/10
Service: n/a
How I felt afterwards: 7/10

More on IG @runnerandfoodie

We visited this restaurant last Sunday and let's just say the food was amazing.
Everything was seasoned to perfection and required no salt nor hot sauce which I love on my greens.
As a pescatarin I thought I would be limited to just the veggies and desserts, but they had several delectable fish options to my delight.
The place is rather small but cozy, with an additional little seating area outside.
The lines form very quickly, and gets pretty crowded, but the staff kept the line moving speedily.
The next time we head to NYC we will definitely be stopping here again!
Much love from (Austin Texas).

I have been coming to this location since it opened. I drove from Brooklyn on a weekly basis to get their honey wings, fried chicken, greens...
But over the last few years and after my visit yesterday,  i am compelled to leave a comment. The beef short ribs and oxtails need more time in the oven; at least an extra hour! The. Short ribs were seasoned well as usual but they were so dry and tuff because that cut of meat CANNOT be rushed! The same for the oxtails, they were tuff! I noticed this also a year ago and i thought it was just a bad batch. Yesterday was the first time i came back in a year and it was still bad! I hope they read this review and make the adjustments. I use to cater from here for all of my corporate events and recommended them to friends and family for their functions as well but I can no longer do this after my last few visits.

Yummy food, great music...but, note...it is not gospel. We went thinking Gospel Brunch (it showed up on Google that way). But...a nice lunch and great time anyway. Basic surroundings...bur, lots of good...good pricing as well.

Went on a Saturday evening, there was a live band and the vibes were great. The food was amazing as well. Buffet style and an assortment of options. Good customer service and friendly. Will definitely be back when we visit Harlem again!

Resto typique de la soul food, tout le monde vient chercher sa barquette √† payer au poids, son verre de citronade maison, on croise des gens vraiment de tous horizons, l'accueil est super, les repas sont de qualit√©, tout est vraiment cuisin√© comme √† la maison. C'est bon et authentique... Et pas cher!

So I‚Äôm a case manager and was recommended to this restaurant to cater for my 50 residence for Christmas dinner. No delivery till after New Year or any help with getting the food to the business that wasn‚Äôt my problem. My problem was the food that I had to serve to the residence. Not only was both trays of mac & cheese burnt, but the cornbread was also and when we tried to call our number was blocked even when we sent the pictures to the manager. I ended up going to the restaurant the next day to complain and tell the manager that he blocked us and the food was horrible.. he said why didn‚Äôt we bring the plate back that day, even though he seen us take up to 45 minutes to get a ride with the food and to call the other store. He  didn‚Äôt care. . He not only ignored me but refused to recognize the mistake. We spent $450 there. Never again
Nice quaint spot to relax and enjoy friends with lots of choices in food to choose. Friendly cashier and server.food good and fruit fresh!

Je recommande ce restaurant situ√© √† Harlem. Le principe est simple : vous choisissez ce qu'il vous pla√Æt et vous payez en fonction du poids de votre barquette et vous en aurez pour votre argent d'autant plus que la cuisine est excellente. C'est l'un des meilleurs restaurants que j'ai fait durant mon s√©jour √†  New York.

Omg! Everything was fantastic. The oxtails were seasoned perfectly but could have been more tender. The mac was tasty. For my vegetables I picked the lima beans & cabbage. They were both delicious. I would prefer my cabbage cut smaller tho. Overall I loved the experience and it was affordable.

Warning : THERES PEAS IN THE POTATO SALAD.
Beef was good but ribs and fried chicken were dry. Liked the corn bread though. You can pick what you like and weigh it so the store lets you try a bit of everything

Listen, this place is OLE skool! Casual, too much excellent food. I happily found it not over-spiced, but very well seasoned & prepared. Soul food is often too sweetened &/or too salted. Not here.
I'll be back. Sorry, no pics

I can see why this place is so highly rated it is so easy to just have wonderful food their friendly easy going and you can just get what you need the prices are amazing as well and I highly recommend the dessert of the banana pudding

Grabbed a plate from here while roaming around H-town. I wanted to try something new in the area. This place probably (maybe) had an open buffet prior to COVID, but like many places, now charged by total weight. I believe my container came up to about $30-$32 total. The best part of the food was probably the seafood rice. It was DELICIOUS and the pieces of calamari, lobster, and everything else in it was flavorful and chewy. The Mac and cheese was "alright", I was expecting way more flavor but it wasn't as flavorful as I thought. I enjoyed it, however. The rice was alright as well, I can't say that the veggies and rice were WOW, but it was doable. I ended up not eating it entirely, as it didn't really have much flavor. The ribs were delicious, I did enjoy it and so were the oxtail. The oxtail were very meaty and flavorful and tasted great. Ultimately, I'd have to give this place about a 3/5. While it was good, it wasn't really mind-blowing and for $30+ I was expecting way more flavor and taste. I guess it's a give and take, since most buffet places make food in bulk which I believe doesn't taste as flavorful as when it isn't prepared that way. You may enjoy it, you may not -- but I do believe there are better options out there for soul food in the area.
Nous avons d√©couvert la soul food faite de sp√©cialit√©s afro-am√©ricaines en plein c≈ìur d'Harlem... et que dire! Service au top et nourriture excellente dans un cadre sain et propre.

So, first time eating here. I purchased some salmon, yellow rice, fish, corn, and some fruits. The rice was salty. However, the fish lacked flavor. The corn was decent. I was scared about the weight making the food expensive. However, $22 for fish and rice is a deal. A regular restaurant or store, you would pay at least $26, and it wouldn't have included the other items or even watermelon. Thus, it was worth the price. The quality of the food just needs some work based on what I got.

I am furious üò° I came from way uptown Bronx (literally a couple blocks away from mount Vernon) I wanted food from "Sweet MaMa". It's been years but I was hoping they were still Guud. They were closed down (plumbing issue). Then the closest soul food place was johnny Kaks (They were closed, didn't update that on Google maps, banner was old grey and worn out and there was scaffolding covering the location ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è) 3rd times a charm right? Not in this case. I look on Google for another soul food restaurant and find Jacob. There was a line inside this tight space and it seemed as if the customers were raving fans so I called up my family and asked if they want a plate. The employees were VERY NICE I had 5 large trays, 3 small, and 2 dessert (small trays as well) one guy told me I can sit trays on the side. When I was in line to pay another guy made multiple trips to put my stuff behind the counter for me. I was there getting food for a while so after I paid i asked if I could use the bathroom and leave my food behind the counter. The problem is THE FOOD IS SPOILED. BASURA. The turkey wings and the corn bread taste and even smelled spoiled. The chicken is undercooked and was still bleeding. üò´ I was so tempted to go back to Harlem and ask for my money back. I also FOUND A HAIR IN THE PAN OF FRIED CHICKEN, I picked it up with the tongs and gave it to the guy just giving them the benefit of the doubt ( maybe it was from a customer). SO DISAPPOINTED AND UPSET. SUCH A WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY. MY STOMACH IS LITERALLY GOING THROUGH IT. THERE ARE SO MANY OF US WHO CAN DO 1,000X BETTER OURSELVES. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND OR GO BACK.  $100+ for spoiled food I'm so upset

When we go, we go early 11am. honestly, even tho they keep it clean. I just like to go before all the people hands been on it Ijs.  My favorite is the baked Turkey and cornbread!! They cook a whole turkey and it‚Äôs soo tender and flavorful not to salty which i enjoy, very tasty..wish they had it every day. And let‚Äôs not forget the cornbread, not to sweet, perfectly buttery and sooo thick like cake . Love it 10 out of 10. Highly recommend . **also their homemade cakes.. especially carrot & coconut pineapple cakes. Very good my mom loves them, and she knows a good cake lol she old school.

Big selection of iconic soul food dishes, all delicious and 100 % on point in terms of taste. The jerk chicken has a good level of spiciness, the fried chicken is crispy outside and tender inside, the sweet potatoes are well cooked and so‚Ä¶
